name: Sensō-ji
descrip_title: Historic temple to the goddess of mercy
descrip_long: Sensō-ji is an ancient Buddhist temple located in Asakusa, Tokyo, Japan. It is Tokyo's oldest temple, and one of its most significant. Formerly associated with the Tendai sect of Buddhism, it became independent after World War II.

name: Tokyo Skytree
descrip_title: Huge tower with an observation deck
descrip_long: Tokyo Skytree is a broadcasting and observation tower in Sumida, Tokyo. It became the tallest structure in Japan in 2010 and reached its full height of 634.0 meters in March 2011, making it the tallest tower in the world, displacing the Canton Tower, and the second tallest structure in the world after the Burj Khalifa.

name: Tokyo Tower
descrip_long: Tokyo Tower is a communications and observation tower in the Shiba-koen district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan. At 332.9 meters, it is the second-tallest structure in Japan.

name: Tokyo Disneyland
descrip_long: Tokyo Disneyland is a 115-acre theme park at the Tokyo Disney Resort in Urayasu, Chiba Prefecture, Japan, near Tokyo. Its main gate is directly adjacent to both Maihama Station and Tokyo Disneyland Station.

name: Meiji Jingu
descrip_title: Famed Shinto shrine with a garden
descrip_long: Meiji Shrine, located in Shibuya, Tokyo, is the Shinto shrine that is dedicated to the deified spirits of Emperor Meiji and his wife, Empress Shōken. The shrine does not contain the emperor's grave, which is located at Fushimi-momoyama, south of Kyoto.

name: Imperial Palace
descrip_long: The Tokyo Imperial Palace is the usual residence of the Emperor of Japan. It is a large park-like area located in the Chiyoda district of the Chiyoda ward of Tokyo and contains several buildings including the main palace, some residences of the Imperial Family, an archive, museums and administrative offices.

name: Odaiba
descrip_title: Waterfront sushi bars & a Ferris wheel
descrip_long: Odaiba today is a large artificial island in Tokyo Bay, Japan, across the Rainbow Bridge from central Tokyo. Odaiba was initially built in this area for defensive purposes in the 1850s.

name: Ueno Park
address: Japan, 〒110-0007 Tōkyō-to, Taito City, Uenokōen, 8−・ 池之端三丁目
descrip_title: Large park with a zoo, a lake & museums
descrip_long: Ueno Park is a spacious public park in the Ueno district of Taitō, Tokyo, Japan. The park was established in 1873 on lands formerly belonging to the temple of Kan'ei-ji.

name: Shinjuku Gyoen National Garden
descrip_title: Sizable park with gardens & a greenhouse
descrip_long: Shinjuku Gyo-en is a large park and garden in Shinjuku and Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan. It was originally a residence of the Naitō family in the Edo period.

name: Tokyo DisneySea
descrip_title: Disney theme park inspired by the sea
descrip_long: Tokyo DisneySea is a theme park at the Tokyo Disney Resort located in Urayasu, Chiba Prefecture, Japan, just outside Tokyo. It opened on 4 September 2001, at a cost of 335 billion yen.

name: Tokyo Disney Resort
descrip_long: The Tokyo Disney Resort is a theme park and vacation resort located in Urayasu, Chiba, Japan, just east of Tokyo. It is owned and operated by the Oriental Land Company with a license from The Walt Disney Company.

name: Yoyogi Park
descrip_title: Park on site of the 1964 Olympic village
descrip_long:
Yoyogi Park is a park in Yoyogikamizonocho, Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan, located adjacent to Harajuku Station and Meiji Shrine.
The park is a popular Tokyo destination.

name: Harajuku
address: Harajuku, Jingumae, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-0001, Japan
descrip_long: Harajuku is a district in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan. Harajuku is the common name given to a geographic area spreading from Harajuku Station to Omotesando, corresponding on official maps of Shibuya ward as Jingūmae 1 chōme to 4 chōme.

name: Roppongi
descrip_long: Roppongi is a district of Minato, Tokyo, Japan, famous for the affluent Roppongi Hills development area and popular night club scene. A few foreign embassies are located near Roppongi, and the night life is popular with locals and foreigners alike. It is in the central part of Tokyo, south of Akasaka and north of Azabu.

name: Mount Takao
address: Mount Takao, Takaomachi, Hachioji, Tokyo 193-0844, Japan
descrip_title: Small, scenic mountain with a cable car
descrip_long: Mount Takao is a mountain in the city of Hachiōji, Tokyo, Japan. It is protected within Meiji no Mori Takao Quasi-National Park.

name: Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building
descrip_long: The Tokyo Metropolitan Government Building, also referred to as Tochō for short, houses the headquarters of the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, which governs the special wards, cities, towns and villages that constitutes the whole Tokyo Metropolis.

name: Ghibli Museum
descrip_long: The Ghibli Museum is a museum showcasing the work of the Japanese animation studio Studio Ghibli. It is located in Inokashira Park in Mitaka, a western city of Tokyo, Japan.

name: Hamarikyu Gardens
descrip_title: Former Imperial gardens open to public
descrip_long: Hamarikyu Gardens is a public park in Chūō ward, Tokyo, Japan. Located at the mouth of the Sumida River, it was opened to the public on April 1, 1946.

name: Rainbow Bridge
address: 3 Chome Kaigan, Minato City, Tokyo 105-0000, Japan
descrip_title: Bridge known for its colorful lights
descrip_long:
The Rainbow Bridge is a suspension bridge crossing northern Tokyo Bay between Shibaura Pier and the Odaiba waterfront development in Minato, Tokyo, Japan.
It was built by Kawasaki Heavy Industries, with construction starting in 1987 and completed in 1993. The bridge is 798 metres long with a main span of 580 metres. Officially called the "Shuto Expressway No.

name: Omotesandō
descrip_long: Omotesandō is a zelkova tree-lined avenue located in Shibuya and Minato, Tokyo, stretching from the Meiji Shrine entrance to Aoyama-dōri, where Omotesandō Station can be found.

name: Roppongi Hills
descrip_long: Roppongi Hills is a development project in Tokyo and one of Japan's largest integrated property developments, located in the Roppongi district of Minato, Tokyo.

name: Tokyo National Museum
descrip_title: Grand site for Japanese art & antiques
descrip_long: The Tokyo National Museum or TNM is an art museum in Ueno Park in the Taitō ward of Tokyo, Japan. It is one of the four museums operated by the National Institutes for Cultural Heritage, is considered the oldest national museum in Japan, is the largest art museum in Japan, and is one of the largest art museums in the world.

name: Ueno Zoo
descrip_long: The Ueno Zoo is a 14.3-hectare zoo, managed by the Tokyo Metropolitan Government, and located in Taitō, Tokyo, Japan. It is Japan's oldest zoo, opening on March 20, 1882.

name: Kaminarimon Gate Senso-ji
address: 2 Chome-3-1 Asakusa, Taito City, Tōkyō-to 111-0032, Japan
descrip_title: Landmark temple gate with a huge lantern

name: Takeshita Street
address: 1 Chome-17 Jingumae, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-0001, Japan
descrip_long: Takeshita Street is a pedestrian shopping street lined with fashion boutiques, cafes and restaurants in Harajuku in Tokyo, Japan.

name: Edo-Tokyo Museum
descrip_long: The Edo-Tokyo Museum is a historical museum located at 1-4-1 Yokoami, Sumida-Ku, Tokyo in the Ryogoku district. The museum opened in March 1993 to preserve Edo's cultural heritage, and features city models of Edo and Tokyo between 1590 and 1964.

name: Kabukicho
descrip_title: Golden Gai bar scene & Samurai Museum
descrip_long: Kabukichō is an entertainment and red-light district in Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan. Kabukichō is the location of many host and hostess clubs, love hotels, shops, restaurants, and nightclubs, and is often called the "Sleepless Town".

name: Nakamise Shopping Street
descrip_title: Busy street lined with souvenir stalls

name: Inokashira Park
address: 1 Chome-18-31 Gotenyama, 武蔵野市 Tōkyō-to 180-0005, Japan
descrip_title: Urban green space with boating & a zoo
descrip_long:
Inokashira Park is a park which straddles Musashino and Mitaka in western Tokyo, Japan. Inokashira Pond and the Kanda River water source, established during the Edo period, are the primary sources of the Kanda River.
The land was given to Tokyo in 1913.

name: Odaiba Ōedo-Onsen Monogatari
descrip_title: Simple hotel with carnival games & a spa

name: Rikugien Gardens
descrip_title: Classical garden with a pond & teahouses

name: Mori Art Museum
address: Japan, 〒106-6150 Tōkyō-to, Minato City, Roppongi, 6-chōme−10−１, Roppongi Hills Mori Tower, 53階
descrip_title: Modern art museum in a skyscraper
descrip_long: The Mori Art Museum is a contemporary art museum founded by the real estate developer Minoru Mori in the Roppongi Hills Mori Tower in the Roppongi Hills complex both of which he built in Tokyo, Japan.

name: National Museum of Western Art
descrip_long:
The National Museum of Western Art is the premier public art gallery in Japan specializing in art from the Western tradition.
The museum is in the museum and zoo complex in Ueno Park in Taito, central Tokyo. It received 1,162,345 visitors in 2016.

name: Sanrio Puroland
descrip_long: Sanrio Puroland, also known as Hello Kitty Land, is an indoor theme park located in Tama New Town, Tokyo, Japan that attracts over 1.5 million visitors per year.

name: Sunshine City
address: 3 Chome-1 Higashiikebukuro, Toshima City, Tokyo 170-8630, Japan
descrip_long: Sunshine City is a building complex located in East Ikebukuro, Toshima, Tokyo, Japan. It has the 240 metre tall Sunshine 60 skyscraper at its centre.

name: Shinjuku Golden Gai
descrip_long: Shinjuku Golden Gai is a small area of Kabukicho, Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan, famous both as an area of architectural interest and for its nightlife.

name: Zojoji Temple
descrip_long: San'en-zan Zōjō-ji is a Jōdo-shū Buddhist temple in Tokyo, Japan. It is the main temple of the Jōdo-shū Chinzei sect of Buddhism in the Kantō region,.Zōjō-ji is notable for its relationship with the Tokugawa clan, the rulers of Japan during the Edo period, with six of the Tokugawa shōguns being buried in the Taitoku-in Mausoleum in the temple grounds.

name: National Museum of Nature and Science
descrip_title: Museum with an array of science exhibits
descrip_long: The National Museum of Nature and Science is in the northeast corner of Ueno Park in Tokyo. Opened in 1871, it has had several names, including Ministry of Education Museum, Tokyo Museum, Tokyo Science Museum, the National Science Museum of Japan, and the National Museum of Nature and Science as of 2007.

name: The National Art Center, Tokyo
descrip_title: Temporary exhibitions in a modern space
descrip_long: The National Art Center is a museum in Roppongi, Minato, Tokyo, Japan. A joint project of the Agency for Cultural Affairs and the National Museums Independent Administrative Institution, it stands on a site formerly occupied by a research facility of the University of Tokyo.

name: Roppongi Hills Mori Tower
descrip_title: Skyscraper with a museum, shops & more
descrip_long: Roppongi Hills Mori Tower is a 54-story mixed-use skyscraper in Roppongi, Minato, Tokyo. Completed in 2003 and named after builder Minoru Mori, it is the centerpiece of the Roppongi Hills urban development.

name: Tokyo Midtown
descrip_title: Posh shopping & dining hub with a park
descrip_long: Tokyo Midtown is a 569,000-square-meter mixed-use development in Akasaka, Tokyo, Japan. Completed in March 2007, the $3 billion project includes office, residential, commercial, hotel, and leisure space, and the new quarters of the Suntory Museum of Art.

name: Shinobazu Pond
descrip_title: Pond with boat rentals & bird watching
descrip_long: The Shinobazu Pond is a pond within Ueno Park, and a historically prominent Shitamachi feature often appearing in history and works of art.

name: Tokyo Joypolis
address: Japan, 〒135-0091 Tōkyō-to, Minato City, Daiba, 1-chōme−6−１ DECKS Tokyo Beach 3F～5F

name: Sumida Aquarium
address: Japan, 〒131-0045 Tōkyō-to, Sumida City, Oshiage, 1-chōme−1−２ 東京スカイツリータウン・ソラマチ 5-6F

name: Mount Mitake
address: Mount Mitake, Mitakesan, Ome, Tokyo 198-0175, Japan
descrip_title: Day-trip spot with a cable car & shrine
descrip_long: Mount Mitake is a mountain in the Chichibu Tama Kai National Park near Tokyo, Japan. It stands 929 m tall. On the mountain is a Shinto shrine where practices such as Futomani divination take place.

name: Showa Kinen Park
descrip_title: National park with bike trails & cafes

name: Tokyo Sea Life Park
descrip_long: Tokyo Sea Life Park is a public aquarium located in Edogawa Ward, Tokyo. It can be accessed from Kasai-Rinkai Park Station.

name: Hibiya Park
descrip_long: Hibiya Park is a park in Chiyoda City, Tokyo, Japan. It covers an area of 161,636.66m² between the east gardens of the Imperial Palace to the north, the Shinbashi district to the southeast and the Kasumigaseki government district to the west.

name: Kichijōji
descrip_long: Kichijōji is a neighborhood in the city of Musashino in Tokyo, Japan. It is centered on a compact but very popular commercial area to the north of its train station and to the south a little, with a full range of shops, restaurants, bars, and coffee houses.

name: Yomiuri Land
descrip_title: Amusement park, roller coaster, bungee jumping, ice skating, and sea lions
descrip_long: Yomiuriland is a Japanese amusement park that first opened in 1964. It is situated on hillsides, and features rides such as roller coasters and water flumes.

name: The East Gardens of the Imperial Palace
Nezu Shrine
descrip_long:
Nezu Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in the Bunkyō ward of Tokyo, Japan.
Established in 1705, it is one of the oldest places of worship in the city, and several of the buildings on the shrine grounds have been designated as Important Cultural Property.

name: Sumida Park
address: 1 Chome-3 Mukojima, Sumida City, Tokyo 131-0033, Japan
descrip_title: Scenic urban park with cherry blossoms
descrip_long: Sumida Park is a public park in Sumida and Taitō, Tokyo, Japan. Cherry blossoms can be seen in spring, and the Sumidagawa Fireworks Festival is held in July.

name: Kappabashi Utensils Street
address: 3 Chome-18-2 Matsugaya, Taito City, Tōkyō-to 110-0036, Japan

name: National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation
descrip_long: The National Museum of Emerging Science and Innovation, simply known as the Miraikan, is a museum created by Japan's Science and Technology Agency. It was opened in 2001.

name: Shitamachi Museum
descrip_long: The Shitamachi Museum is a museum in Ueno, Taito, Tokyo, Japan. Located on the shores of Shinobazu Pond within Ueno Park, it is dedicated to the traditional culture of Tokyo's Shitamachi.

name: Edo-Tokyo Open Air Architectural Museum
descrip_long:
The Edo-Tokyo Open Air Architectural Museum in Koganei Park, Tokyo, Japan, is a museum of historic Japanese buildings.
The park includes many buildings from the ordinary middle class Japanese experience to the homes of wealthy and powerful individuals such as former Prime Minister Takahashi Korekiyo, out in the open in a park.

name: Kasairinkai Park
address: 6 Chome-2 Rinkaicho, 江戸川区 Tokyo 134-0086, Japan
descrip_title: Large park with a Ferris wheel & gardens

name: Shibuya Crossing
address: 2 Chome-2-1 Dogenzaka, Shibuya City, Tōkyō-to 150-0043, Japan
descrip_long: Shibuya Crossing, or Shibuya Scramble Crossing, is a popular scramble crossing in Shibuya, Tokyo, Japan. It is located in front of the Shibuya Station Hachikō exit and stops vehicles in all directions to allow pedestrians to inundate the entire intersection.

name: Daikanransha
descrip_title: Soaring ferris wheel with Mt. Fuji views
descrip_long:
Daikanransha is a 115-metre tall Ferris wheel at Palette Town in Odaiba, Tokyo, Japan.
When it opened in 1999, it was the world's tallest Ferris wheel.

name: Toshimaen
address: 3 Chome-25-1 Koyama, Nerima City, Tōkyō-to 176-0022, Japan
descrip_title: Water park with rides, pools & eateries
descrip_long: Toshimaen is an amusement park in Nerima, Tokyo, Japan, owned by the Seibu Group. It has a variety of rides, including three roller coasters, and a water park with 25 slides and six pools.

name: Tokyo Dome City
address: 1 Chome-3-61 Koraku, Bunkyo City, Tōkyō-to 112-0004, Japan
descrip_long: Tokyo Dome City, referred to as Big Egg City before January 1, 2000, is an entertainment complex in Bunkyo, Tokyo, Japan. It includes the world's largest roofed baseball stadium, known as Tokyo Dome; an amusement park known as Tokyo Dome City Attractions; and Korakuen Hall.

name: Nezu Museum
descrip_title: Museum with Japanese & East Asian art
descrip_long:
The Nezu Museum, formerly known as the Nezu Institute of Fine Arts, is an art museum in the Minato district of Tokyo, Japan.
The museum houses the private collection of pre-modern Japanese and East Asian art of Nezu Kaichirō.

name: teamLab Borderless
address: Japan, 〒135-0064 Tōkyō-to, Koto City, Aomi, 1-chōme−3−８ お台場パレットタウン

address_components.long_name: お台場パレットタウン
address_components.short_name: お台場パレットタウン

name: Tokyo Metropolitan Art Museum
descrip_long:
The Tokyo Metropolitan Art Museum is an art museum in Tokyo, Japan. It is one of Japan's many museums which are supported by a prefectural government. The current structure, designed by Kunio Maekawa, was completed in 1975.
The museum is located in Ueno Park.

name: Aogashima
descrip_long: Aogashima is a volcanic Japanese island in the Philippine Sea. The island is administered by Tokyo and is approximately 358 kilometres south of Tokyo and 64 kilometres south of Hachijō-jima.

name: Yasukuni Shrine
descrip_title: Shrine dedicated to those killed in war
descrip_long: Yasukuni Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in Chiyoda, Tokyo. It was founded by Emperor Meiji in June 1869 and commemorates those who died in service of Japan from the Boshin War of 1868–1869 through the First Indochina War of 1946–1954.

name: National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo
descrip_title: Gallery for mainly modern Japanese works
descrip_long:
The Tokyo National Museum of Modern Art in Tokyo, Japan, is the foremost museum collecting and exhibiting modern Japanese art.
This Tokyo museum is also known by the English acronym MOMAT.

name: Kitanomaru Park
descrip_long:
Kitanomaru Park is a public park in Chiyoda, Tokyo, Japan located North of the Tokyo Imperial Palace.
The park is the location of both the Nippon Budokan, an indoor sports and performance venue, the Science Museum and the National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo.

name: Fujiko F Fujio Museum
descrip_title: Works by manga artist Fujiko Fujio

name: Tokyo Dome City Hall
descrip_title: Amusement park, bouldering, roller coaster, and concert
descrip_long: Tokyo Dome City Hall is a facility for sport, fashion show, circus, and live music, located in Tokyo, inside of Tokyo Dome City. It is on the opposite corner of the Tokyo Dome, and hosts a variety of events at any given time, including boxing and live concerts.

name: Kyū-Furukawa Gardens
descrip_long: Kyū-Furukawa Gardens is a Tokyo metropolitan park in Nishigahara, Kita, Tokyo. The park includes an old western-style mansion with a rose garden, and a Japanese garden which were built in early 20th century.

name: Shinjuku Central Park
address: 2 Chome-11 Nishishinjuku, Shinjuku City, Tokyo 160-0023, Japan
descrip_title: Urban green space with paths & play area
descrip_long: Shinjuku Central Park is a park in western Shinjuku, Tokyo, Japan. The park is bordered by Honnnan Dori and Kita Dori to the north, Junisha Dori to the west, Suido Dori or Minami Dori to the south, and Koen Dori to the east.

name: Akasaka Palace
address: Akasaka Palace, 2-chōme-1-1 Motoakasaka, Minato City, Tōkyō-to 107-0051, Japan
descrip_long:
Akasaka Palace, or the State Guest House, is one of the two state guest houses of the Government of Japan. The other state guesthouse is the Kyoto State Guest House.
The palace was originally built as the Imperial Palace for the Crown Prince in 1909.

name: Chidorigafuchi Green Way
address: 2 Chome-1 Kudanminami, Chiyoda City, Tokyo 102-0074, Japan

name: Hie Shrine
descrip_long: The Hie Shrine is a Shinto shrine in Nagatachō, Chiyoda, Tokyo, Japan. Its June 15 Sannō Matsuri is one of the three great Japanese festivals of Edo.

name: Shiba Park
descrip_title: City park encircling a temple complex
descrip_long:
Shiba Park is a public park in Minato, Tokyo, Japan built around the temple of Zōjō-ji.
The park is located between the Minato municipal offices and Tokyo Tower.

name: Sunshine Aquarium
address: Japan, 〒170-8630 Tōkyō-to, Toshima City, Higashiikebukuro, 3-chōme−1, サンシャインシティ ワールドインポートマートビル 屋上
descrip_title: City aquarium with shows & unique pools

name: Kanda Myōjin (Kanda Shrine)
descrip_title: Enduring shrine with red & gold decor

name: Asukayama Park
descrip_long: Asukayama Park is a public park in Kita, Tokyo, Japan.

name: Aoyama
address: 1-chōme-25-25番18号 Sakurajōsui, Setagaya City, Tōkyō-to 156-0045, Japan
descrip_long: Aoyama is one of the wealthiest neighborhoods of Tokyo, located in the northwest portion of Minato Ward. The area is well known for its international fashion houses, cafes and restaurants.

name: Shikine-jima
descrip_title: Quaint island with beaches & tide pools
descrip_long: Shikine-jima is a volcanic Japanese island in the Philippine Sea. The island is administered by Tōkyō and located approximately 160 kilometres south of Tōkyō and 36 kilometres south of Shimoda Shizuoka Prefecture.

name: Jindai Botanical Gardens
descrip_title: Major botanical garden known for roses

name: Tokyo Metropolitan Teien Art Museum
descrip_title: Art museum in former prince's home
descrip_long:
The Tokyo Metropolitan Teien Art Museum is an art museum in Tokyo, Japan.
The museum is located in Minato ward, just east of Meguro Station.

name: Asakusa Shrine
descrip_long:
Asakusa Shrine is a Shinto shrine located in the Asakusa district of Tokyo, Japan.
Also known as Sanja-sama, it is one of the most famous Shinto shrines in the city. The shrine honors the three men who founded the Sensō-ji. Asakusa Shrine is part of a larger grouping of sacred buildings in the area.

name: Kokyo Gaien National Garden
descrip_title: Scenic, grassy park with palace views
descrip_long: Kokyo Gaien National Garden is a national park in Chiyoda, Tokyo. It is located south of Tokyo Imperial Palace.

name: Hachikō Memorial Statue
address: 1 Chome-2 Dogenzaka, Shibuya City, Tokyo 150-0043, Japan
descrip_title: Landmark statue of a loyal dog

name: Tokyo City View And Sky Deck
address: Japan, 〒106-0032 Tōkyō-to, Minato City, Roppongi, 6-chōme−10−１ ヒルズ森タワ 52階

name: Zoorasia, Yokohama Municipal Zoo
descrip_title: Zoo with themed habitats & camel rides

name: National Diet Building
descrip_long: The National Diet Building is the building where both houses of the National Diet of Japan meet. It is located at Nagatachō 1-chome 7-1, Chiyoda, Tokyo.
